subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Night Photography with a 35mm
author: Rheta@carolina.rr.com
full_text:
Hi Chad,

   I still use a 35mm and love it!  I use an attached flash at night or in ow light.  You can also use a higher speed film although if you are going to anlarge your photos very much they will be grainier.  I use digital cameras too but love my 35 mm and have gotten some of my best photos with it.

                             Rheta
---- Chad <cawiggins78@...> wrote: 
> Hey Guys,
> 
> Any of you still use a 35mm to take pictures with? I have 2 of them
> and tried over the weekend to utilize them in an investigation. The
> exposure time on these things is like 30 seconds. It's such a pain in
> the butt. If you do use the 35mm, what kind of settings do you use?
> Any advice? I am totally new to night photography. Has everyone gone
> to digital now or what?
> 
> Chad
>
